examples: Restraint of the organs of sense, on which success in study and discipline depends, can be enforced by abandoning lust, anger, greed, vanity (māna), haughtiness (mada) and overjoy (harṣa).

verbs.description: overjoy (third-person singular simple present overjoys, present participle overjoying, simple past and past participle overjoyed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To give great joy, delight or pleasure to.
examples: The prospect of writing three exams in a row without a break does not overjoy me.

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare) To give too much joy to.
examples: Ah, child, thou art but half thy darling mother’s;
My light in thee would outglow all in others;
But niggard Nature’s trick of birth
Renewal of the loved on earth

entries.meaning: (intransitive, obsolete) To take too much pleasure (in something).
examples: Your deeds my hart surchargd with ouerioying:
